Class State

  • java.lang.Object
    • State

  • public class State
extends java.lang.Object
    Created by Steven Bruman on 4/12/2018. Edited by Steven Bruman and William Jacobs Version 4/18/2018

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      State(Unit[][] b, int l, int m, java.util.ArrayList<Moves> memA, java.util.ArrayList<Moves> memP)
      This is the top level State which does not haev to deal with pruning.
      State(Unit[][] b, int l, int m, Moves old, Moves knew, double[] p, java.util.ArrayList<Moves> memA, java.util.ArrayList<Moves> memP)
      This is all other States that have to deal with pruning as well as pieces that have moved.

      Returns all possible moves that could be made from the State.

      Return a 2D ArrayList that keeps all possible Moves by the same piece together.
      int getOrigial()
      Returns an int representing the index in the moveable ArrayList that corresponds to the piece chosen to move.
      double getScore()
      Returns the score of the State.

    • Constructor Detail

      • State

        public State(Unit[][] b,
             int l,
             int m,
             java.util.ArrayList<Moves> memA,
             java.util.ArrayList<Moves> memP)
        This is the top level State which does not haev to deal with pruning.
        Parameters:
        b - The 2D Unit array that represents how the AI views the board.
        l - The level of the State within the Minimax tree.
        m - The maximum level of the Minimax tree.
        memA - An ArrayList containing the last 2 Moves of the AI on the shadowBoard.
        memP - An ArrayList containing the last 2 Moves of the Player on the shadowBoard.

      • State

        public State(Unit[][] b,
             int l,
             int m,
             Moves old,
             Moves knew,
             double[] p,
             java.util.ArrayList<Moves> memA,
             java.util.ArrayList<Moves> memP)
        This is all other States that have to deal with pruning as well as pieces that have moved.
        Parameters:
        b - The 2D Unit array that represents how the AI views the board.
        l - The level of the State within the Minimax tree.
        m - The maximum level of the Minimax tree.
        old - Where the moving piece was.
        knew - Where the moving piece is.
        p - The int array that the State will use to prune its search
        memA - An ArrayList containing the last 2 Moves of the AI on the shadowBoard.
        memP - An ArrayList containing the last 2 Moves of the Player on the shadowBoard.

      • calcScore

        public void calcScore()
        Calculates the total score of the State. It adds the scores of pieces owned by the AI and subtracts the scores of pieces owned by the player.

      • getScore

        Returns the score of the State.

      • getOrigial

        public int getOrigial()
        Returns an int representing the index in the moveable ArrayList that corresponds to the piece chosen to move.
        Returns:

      • getBestMove

        public double getBestMove()
        Determines the best possible moves via a Minimax algorithm that utilizes alpha-beta pruning. First the moveable pieces are determined, then the possible moves of those pieces are generated. These Moves are used to create the next level of States, each with a different board. The process is repeated until the maxLevel is reached. Then the score is calculated and returned back up the chain. Then, alaph-beta pruning begins to prune worse paths off.
        Returns:
        double Represents either the score of the State, the score of the best move of the State, or the index of the best move of the State depending on the level of the State
